result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin T Dvorak was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Must report to Probation by 3:00 p.m. on Monday, October 17, 2016.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
Upon successful completion of Probation, Defendant will not be required to register as a sex offender.

timeConds.notes: 100 hours of Community Service each year while on Probation for a total of 200 hours.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin T Dvorak

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Justin T Dvorak in court with attorney James H Krave.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Victim rights have been complied with. Defendant pleads guilty. Court accepts the plea and finds the Defendant guilty.  
Argument by State. Argument by Defense. Defendant addresses the court. 
Court relates and orders: 

SW - 2 year probation - Must report by 3:00 PM on Monday 10/17/16. 
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
Upon successful completion of probation, Defendant will not be required to register as a sex offender. 
Must submit DNA sample and pay the surcharge. 
100 hours community service each year while on probation for a total of 200 hours. 
Costs.   

Order for DNA given to the defendant in court. Report to Barron County Jail on Tuesday/Thursday, by October 20, 2016, between 1:00 and 5:00 PM.
